title: 5 Colorado hotels ranked among world's, country's best (Slideshow)
text:
See All Homes of the Day The Little Nell is new to the top 100 list, and the Sonnenalp not only jumped into that exclusive ranking but also garnered a new place among the top 25 continental resorts. Two Colorado resorts that made the top-25 list last year — Four Seasons Resort & Residences in Vail and the Viceroy Snowmass in Snowmass Village — fell out of the rankings for 2015. Click the image above to view photos of each of the five hotels. Meanwhile, the Four Seasons Denver Hotel repeated on the list of the best hotels in the U.S. with more than 100 rooms, coming in at No. 20. And this year it was joined at No. 24 by the St. Julien Hotel & Spa in Boulder, which was honored by Travel + Leisure for the first time. “We’re incredibly honored to be named one of the top hotels in the country,” said Bob Trotter , general manager of the 201-room St. Julien, which has recently ramped up its sustainability program and expanded its packages to attract more leisure travelers. “St. Julien has been an annual member of the Conde Nast Traveler Reader’s Choice list, and we’re ecstatic to now be recognized as a top hotel by not one, but two of the top travel publications in the world.” The magazine ranked the Oberoi Udaivilas in Udaipur, India as the top hotel in the world. Its readers chose the Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park as the best large hotel in the continental U.S. Rankings will be featured in the August issue of the publication.
